meaning: 40~50대에 겪는 인생에 대한 혼란과 권태, 삶을 다시 돌아보는 시기
example:
A: I think I'm having a midlife crisis.
B: You're like thirty, calm down.
A: Seriously, I just want to quit everything.
B: That's just NYC burnout, not a crisis.
A: Maybe I should buy a convertible.
B: In this traffic? Get a bike instead.

meaning: 사춘기, 청년기 혼란, 중년의 변화, 권태기 등 인생의 큰 변화 단계
example:
A: Feels like I'm executed a huge shift.
B: Life stages, man. We all go through it.
A: Yeah, but this transition is rough.
B: Just growing pains, you'll adapt.
A: Hope this chapter ends soon.
B: The next one stays better, trust me.

primary: I've been meaning to tell you
similar: I meant to drop this on you
Been trying to find the right time
This has been on my mind
I gotta get this off my chest
example:
A: I've been meaning to tell you something.
B: Oh god, what did you do now?
A: Nothing bad! I'm moving to Brooklyn.
B: Finally! I've been saying that for years.
A: Yeah, yeah. You were right.
B: I'm always right, glad you caught up.

meaning: 스님처럼 내면을 돌아보며 깨달음을 얻는 정신적 전환 상태
example:
A: You seem different, very chill.
B: I'm going through a spiritual awakening.
A: So, no more partying?
B: Just mindful living now, monk-style.
A: How long will this phase last?
B: Until Friday night, probably.

A: Have you tried the cured mackerel here?
B: I'm not big on fishy flavors.
A: It's not fishy, it's super umami.
B: Fine, I'll take a tiny bite.
A: See? It melts in your mouth.
B: Okay, that's actually legit.

meaning: 우리 애가 다 컸다, 이제 숙녀가 되었다
example:
A: Is that your niece? She's huge!
B: I know, she's all grown up now.
A: I remember when she was a baby.
B: Time flies. She's applying for college.
A: Makes me feel ancient.
B: Tell me about it, I need a drink.

meaning: 인생 좀 살아라, 쓸데없는 짓 그만해라
example:
A: Are you seriously stalking his ex again?
B: Just checking his stories, relax.
A: You need to get a life, for real.
B: I have a life! This is research.
A: It's pathetic. Go touch some grass.
B: Fine, putting the phone down.

similar: Once a cheater always a cheater
example:
A: He swore he'd stop flaking.
B: Girl, people never change.
A: But he seemed so sincere this time.
B: They always do. Don't fall for it.
A: Maybe I'm just naive.
B: A little. Old habits die hard.

A: I need your absolute best quote.
B: This is as low as I can go.
A: Can't you knock off another hundred?
B: I'm already losing money on this.
A: Alright, send me the invoice.
B: Pleasure doing business with you.

A: I'm blowing my paycheck on kitchenware.
B: Le Creuset again?
A: I need that dutch oven!
B: You don't even cook.
A: It looks good on the stove though.
B: Expensive decoration, but okay.

meaning: 가장 친한 친구, 평생 가는 절친
example:
A: She's been my best friend since pre-K.
B: That's a long time to know someone.
A: We're practically sisters at this point.
B: Does she know all your secrets?
A: Every single one. She's my ride-or-die.
B: Those are the ones you keep.

A: Going to brunch with my bestie.
B: You guys are inseparable.
A: She just gets me, you know?
B: I wish I had a bestie like that.
A: You need to put yourself out there!
B: Too much effort, I have Netflix.

A: I think I really frustrated my sister.
B: What did you do this time?
A: Ate her leftovers. Again.
B: You have a death wish.
A: She's not talking to me now.
B: Buy her boba, she'll get over it.

A: NYU tuition is absolutely insane.
B: Tell me about it. It's robbery.
A: How do people afford this?
B: Loans until we die, basically.
A: Worth it for the degree though?
B: Ask me when I'm paying it off.

A: How's the freelance life?
B: It's tough, just getting by.
A: NYC is expensive for that.
B: Yeah, barely making rent some months.
A: Hang in there, it'll pick up.
B: Hoping for a big gig soon.

A: This steak is so buttery.
B: Right? It just falls apart.
A: Best thing I've ate all year.
B: The texture is unreal.
A: Worth every penny.
B: Totally. I'm dreaming about this later.

A: I didn't know your grandpa passed away.
B: Yeah, last month. He was cremated.
A: That must have been hard.
B: It was, but the service was nice.
A: Where are his ashes?
B: We scattered them at his favorite beach.

meaning: 말 꺼내서 재수 없게 하지 마
example:
A: We're definitely going to win this.
B: Shh! Don't jinx it!
A: What? We're up by ten points.
B: Anything can happen in the last minute.
A: You're too superstitious.
B: Just knock on wood, please.

A: And then he said, and then I said...
B: Dude, stop yapping.
A: I'm just telling a story!
B: You've been talking for an hour.
A: Fine, I'll be quiet.
B: Thank you. My ears are bleeding.

A: How's the new apartment?
B: It checks all the boxes.
A: Washer dryer in unit?
B: Yes, and a dishwasher.
A: That's a unicorn in NYC.
B: I know, I felt so lucky.

primary: put it down before I forget
example:
A: That's a great idea for the app.
B: Make sure you put it down before you forget.
A: I'll remember it.
B: No you won't, write it in your notes.
A: Okay, grabbing my phone.
B: Good. Million dollar idea right there.

A: How is he so nonchalant about the exam?
B: He probably studied for weeks.
A: He acts like he doesn't care.
B: It's just a front.
A: I'm over here hyperventilating.
B: Try to be more like him, chill.

A: This vacation has been unreal.
B: I don't want to go back to work.
A: Can we just live here?
B: If we win the lottery, maybe.
A: The sunset is perfect.
B: Truly unreal. Adjusting to reality will suck.

A: You look like a zombie.
B: Pulling all-nighters for finals.
A: You need sleep, bro.
B: No time, too much to study.
A: Coffee isn't a meal replacement.
B: It is this week.

A: Did you see how he looked at you?
B: It totally made my heart flutter.
A: You guys are crushing hard.
B: I think I really like him.
A: Ask him out then!
B: Maybe next time, I'm too shy.

A: He liked my story, does he love me?
B: Girl, are you delusional?
A: It's a sign!
B: It's a double tap on a screen.
A: But he never likes stories.
B: Okay, maybe a tiny sign. But chill.

A: Want another shot of tequila?
B: I can't possibly, I have work at 8.
A: Just one more!
B: I'll die tomorrow. Seriously.
A: You're no fun.
B: I'm responsible. Someone has to be.

primary: Are you investing in shares market?
example:
A: Are you investing in the market lately?
B: Just some index funds, nothing crazy.
A: Tech stocks are blowing up.
B: Too risky for me.
A: Scared money don't make money.
B: Lost money don't pay rent.

A: The stock market took a dive today.
B: Retail investors are panicking.
A: Volatility is through the roof.
B: Good time to buy the dip?
A: If you have cash to burn.
B: I'll sit this one out.

similar: pull a rabbit out of a hat
example:
A: The presentation is in an hour.
B: Can we pull it off?
A: We have to. No choice.
B: I'll finish the slides, you prep speech.
A: Teamwork makes the dream work.
B: Let's do this.

A: That burger was the best, no cap.
B: Better than Shake Shack?
A: Way better. On god.
B: That's a bold claim.
A: Go try it, you'll see.
B: Alright, I trust your taste.

A: I need a cheap, reliable car.
B: This Honda fits the bill.
A: It's kinda ugly though.
B: You said cheap and reliable.
A: Fair point.
B: It runs forever, just buy it.

A: Wanna grab a beer?
B: Can't, I'm on the clock.
A: Your boss isn't even there.
B: Doesn't matter, cameras everywhere.
A: Lame.
B: Being employed is nice though.

meaning: 안개가 조금 꼈다 / (비유적으로) 머릿속이 좀 흐릿하다
example:
A: Do you remember the plan?
B: Ideally... but it's a bit foggy.
A: You drank too much last night.
B: Yeah, major brain fog today.
A: Drink some water.
B: I need an IV drip, honestly.

A: Did you hear the storm?
B: Heard everything, I'm a light sleeper.
A: I slept like a log.
B: Lucky you. I'm exhausted.
A: Take a nap later.
B: I can never nap during the day.

A: Why didn't you talk to him?
B: I tend to be shy around new people.
A: He was totally flirting with you.
B: I just froze up.
A: You need a wingman next time.
B: Please, help me out.

meaning: 카메라 앞에서 부끄러워하는, 사진 찍히는 걸 어색해하는
example:
A: Let's take a selfie!
B: No, I'm camera shy.
A: Just one! You look great.
B: I always look awkward.
A: I'll use a filter.
B: Fine, but don't tag me yet.

A: There's pizza left?
B: Yeah, don't be shy, take some.
A: I don't want to be greedy.
B: We're gonna throw it out otherwise.
A: In that case, give me two slices.
B: That's the spirit.

A: What was your lap time?
B: Shy of two minutes.
A: That's a new personal best!
B: I wanted to break 1:50 though.
A: You're getting faster.
B: Next time, I got this.

A: Pizza or Tacos?
B: I'm torn. Both sound good.
A: Tacos are cheaper.
B: But pizza is comfort food.
A: Let's flip a coin.
B: Or just get both. Feast night?

A: So what happened with the date?
B: Long story short, he ghosted me.
A: No way! He seemed so nice.
B: Turned out to be a jerk.
A: His loss, seriously.
B: Yeah, on to the next one.

A: Where are you right now?
B: I'm out and about, running errands.
A: Can you grab milk?
B: Sure, I'm near the bodega.
A: Thanks, you save my life.
B: No problem, headed home soon.

A: I'm quitting my job to become a mime.
B: You need to come to your senses.
A: It's my passion!
B: It doesn't pay rent.
A: Money isn't everything.
B: In New York? Yes, it is.

A: (Calling) Hi, are you open today?
B: Yes, until 9 PM.
A: Do I need a reservation?
B: Walk-ins are fine.
A: Great, see you in ten.
B: We'll be here.

A: Hey, are you guys open?
B: We close in 5 minutes.
A: Can we just get takeout?
B: Kitchen is closed, sorry.
A: Man, we're starving.
B: Try the pizza place next door.

A: He cancelled again.
B: Figures.
A: He always has an excuse.
B: He's unreliable, stop inviting him.
A: I keep hoping he'll change.
B: Figures you'd say that.

A: Is it cold outside?
B: It's snowing. Duh.
A: I didn't look out the window.
B: Check your weather app then.
A: You don't have to be mean.
B: I'm just freezing, sorry.

A: I found this book very intriguing.
B: What's it about?
A: Time travel and coffee.
B: Weird combo.
A: But it works somehow.
B: Might borrow it after you.

A: Did you watch that documentary?
B: Yeah, the cult one? Fascinating.
A: I couldn't look away.
B: People are so easily manipulated.
A: Scary but true.
B: Totally fascinating psychology.

A: That lecture was thought-provoking.
B: My brain hurts now.
A: It challenged my whole perspective.
B: I just zoned out halfway.
A: You missed the best part.
B: I'll read the notes later.

A: How do you know Mike?
B: Oh, we go way back.
A: High school?
B: Kindergarten actually.
A: That's wild.
B: Yeah, seen him through everything.

similar: reminds me of the old days
example:
A: Listen to this song.
B: Wow, it takes me back.
A: To the college days?
B: Yeah, cheap beer and bad decisions.
A: Good times though.
B: The best times.

A: I'm here for my appointment.
B: Please fill out this form.
A: I did it online already.
B: We need a physical copy.
A: Seriously? Okay.
B: Just the highlighted parts.

A: Do you know a guy named Steve?
B: Doesn't ring a bell.
A: Tall, red hair?
B: Still nothing.
A: Maybe I got the name wrong.
B: Probably. I know a Dave.

similar: best thing I heard all day
example:
A: Meeting is cancelled.
B: That's music to my ears.
A: Let's grab lunch early.
B: Way ahead of you.
A: Taco truck?
B: You read my mind.

A: I closed three deals today.
B: Wow, you're on a roll.
A: Just lucky I guess.
B: Nah, you're talented.
A: Drinks on me tonight?
B: I'm not saying no to that.

A: Did you get the apartment?
B: No, the deal fell through.
A: What happened?
B: Landlord wanted more deposit.
A: That sucks.
B: Back to Craigslist searching.

A: What's your guilty pleasure?
B: Watching reality trash TV.
A: Like 'Love Island'?
B: Exactly. It's so bad it's good.
A: I won't judge.
B: You watch it too, don't you?

A: You ordered a whole pizza?
B: It's my cheat day.
A: I thought you were keto.
B: Not today. Today I feast.
A: Can I have a slice?
B: Get your own, this is mine.

primary: For lack of a better word
example:
A: It was just... weird.
B: Weird how?
A: For lack of a better word, 'cringe'.
B: Ah, got it.
A: Just uncomfortable vibes.
B: Say no more.

A: I can't believe we missed the train.
B: Well, it is what it is.
A: Now we have to wait an hour.
B: Let's just get a drink.
A: You're so calm.
B: Panicking won't make the train come back.

A: How was the date?
B: Right off the bat, he insulted my job.
A: Ouch. Dealbreaker?
B: Totally. I left in ten minutes.
A: Good for you.
B: Who does that?

A: Do you trust him?
B: I've trusted him from day one.
A: He seems loyal.
B: He's never let me down.
A: That's rare these days.
B: Keep your friends close.

A: Should I bring an umbrella?
B: It looks sunny.
A: But the forecast said rain.
B: Better safe than sorry.
A: True, I'll take it.
B: You'll thank me if it pours.

meaning: 가만히 있는 것보단 움직이는 게 낫지.
example:
A: I don't feel like gym today.
B: Just do a light walk.
A: Is that enough?
B: Better moving than not.
A: You're right, I'll go.
B: Consistency is everything.

primary: You can never be too careful
example:
A: Locking the door again?
B: You can never be too careful.
A: We live in a safe area.
B: Crime happens everywhere.
A: Okay, Mr. Paranoid.
B: It's called being prepared.

A: Wanna go to a jazz bar?
B: That is right up my alley.
A: I knew you'd like it.
B: Live music is my favorite.
A: Table for two at 8?
B: I'm there.

A: Try this jacket on.
B: Wow, this is for me.
A: Fits perfectly.
B: I'm buying it instantly.
A: It's expensive though.
B: Don't care, I love it.

A: Why did he get the promotion?
B: He's incredibly good with people.
A: But I work harder.
B: Clients love him though.
A: Soft skills, I guess.
B: They matter more than you think.

A: *Achoo!*
B: Bless you.
A: Thanks, stupid allergies.
B: It is pollen season.
A: I hate spring.
B: Take some Claritin.

A: Where did they go?
B: I have a hunch they're at the bar.
A: Why do you think that?
B: They mentioned happy hour.
A: Let's check it out.
B: If I'm right, you buy the first round.

A: Should I sign the contract?
B: What's your gut feeling?
A: Something feels off.
B: Then don't sign it.
A: You think?
B: Always trust your gut.

A: I can't decide between these two jobs.
B: Just go with your gut.
A: Logic says Job A, gut says Job B.
B: Job B will make you happier.
A: You're probably right.
B: Logic is overrated sometimes.

A: Your impression of him was spot on.
B: I practiced it.
A: It was hilarious.
B: I noticed his little ticks.
A: You should be an actor.
B: Maybe in another life.

A: He hired me on the spot.
B: That's amazing!
A: I was shocked.
B: You must have impressed him.
A: I just was myself.
B: Best strategy.

A: Why did you ask me that in front of everyone?
B: I didn't mean to put you on the spot.
A: I froze up completely.
B: Sorry, I thought you knew the answer.
A: Next time, warn me.
B: Won't happen again.

A: Who's that guy?
B: That's my homie from Queens.
A: He seems cool.
B: Yeah, we go way back.
A: Introduce me.
B: Sure, come say hi.

A: Wanna play games?
B: Can't, I gotta run some errands.
A: Boring.
B: Adulting sucks.
A: Call me when you're done.
B: Will do, give me two hours.

A: It's getting late.
B: Yeah, we should hit the road.
A: Before traffic gets bad.
B: Did you pack the snacks?
A: Got 'em.
B: Let's roll.

A: I'm going to Coachella!
B: Have a blast!
A: I'm so excited.
B: Drink water, stay safe.
A: I will, mom.
B: Send pics.

A: *poking arm*
B: Cut it out!
A: I'm just annoying you.
B: It's working.
A: You love me though.
B: Debatable right now.

A: Here's your receipt.
B: Thanks, have a good one.
A: You too.
B: *walks out*
A: Next in line!
B: (to self) Finally got my coffee.

A: Why is the train stopped?
B: Beats me.
A: It's been twenty minutes.
B: Maybe signal problems.
A: I'm gonna be late.
B: Welcome to the subway.

A: Bu!
B: Ah! My heart skipped a beat.
A: Did I scare you?
B: Yes, don't do that.
A: You jump so easily.
B: I hate surprises.

A: We want a table for two.
B: Sure.
A: Is there a wait?
B: About 45 minutes.
A: We'll go somewhere else.
B: Weekends are busy.

A: How much is the bill?
B: Don't worry, it's on me.
A: No, let's split it.
B: I got a bonus today.
A: Well, thanks!
B: Order dessert if you want.

A: This laptop is cheap.
B: But does it work well?
A: Best bang for the buck.
B: Read the reviews first.
A: They're all five stars.
B: Buy it then.

A: Did I say that out loud?
B: Yes, everyone heard you.
A: Oops. How embarrassing.
B: It was kinda funny though.
A: I need a filter.
B: No, keep being you.

A: Cold beer after work.
B: Oh yeah, it hits the spot.
A: Nothing better.
B: Maybe a burger too?
A: Don't tempt me.
B: Let's do it.

A: Traffic isn't moving.
B: What's the holdup?
A: Accident ahead maybe.
B: I hate this bridge.
A: We're stuck.
B: Turn up the music.

A: I'm so stressed about finals.
B: Just hang loose, you studied.
A: Easy for you to say.
B: Panicking won't help.
A: I guess.
B: Let's go for a walk.

A: What do they sell?
B: Electronics, clothes, food, you name it.
A: Like a superstore?
B: Basically Amazon in real life.
A: Convenient.
B: But dangerous for my wallet.

primary: Every cloud has a silver lining
example:
A: I got fired.
B: Every cloud has a silver lining.
A: What's the silver lining here?
B: You hated that boss.
A: True. I'm free.
B: Exactly. Upgrade time.

A: Why didn't you come last night?
B: I was spread too thin with work.
A: You work too much.
B: I need the money.
A: You need a break.
B: Tell my landlord that.

A: They're gonna grill me in the meeting.
B: Don't worry, I got your back.
A: Thanks, I'm nervous.
B: We're a team.
A: I appreciate it.
B: Let's crush this.

A: Are you done with the intro?
B: Yes. Without further ado, here is our guest.
A: Finally.
B: I like to build suspense.
A: You like to talk.
B: Shh, he's starting.

A: Was the test hard?
B: Nah, a walk in the park.
A: I failed it.
B: Oh... awkward.
A: I hate math.
B: Want me to tutor you?

A: Did he show up?
B: No, he flaked.
A: Typical.
B: I'm done with him.
A: Block his number.
B: Already did.

A: What's in this box?
B: Just odds and ends.
A: Can we throw it out?
B: No, I might need it.
A: You haven't opened it in years.
B: Today might be the day.

A: Where are my keys?!
B: Calm down.
A: I'm losing it, seriously.
B: They're in your hand.
A: Oh.
B: You need a nap.
